docs.snippet: A plan by the home-rental site to curb bias among users rejects the logic of networks like Uber and Facebook, which claim to be neutral platforms.

headline.main: Airbnb, a Silicon Valley Titan, Breaks Ranks in Admitting Its Power

docs.snippet: Institutions are reaching out to younger and global audiences, using emoji-style art history and innovative Snapchats.

headline.print_headline: Old Masters Learn the Art of Snapchat
headline.main: Museums, the New Social Media Darlings

docs.snippet: The president, reacting to a grisly video that showed Mr. Castile being shot by the police in Minnesota, asked the nation to confront racial disparities in law enforcement.

headline.print_headline: 11 Officers Shot, 4 Fatally, at Rally Against Violence
headline.main: After Philando Castile’s Killing, Obama Calls Police Shootings ‘an American Issue’

docs.snippet: Palin speaks of "squirmishes" in the Middle East. It's January and 2016 is already cause to squirm.
Twitter is hardly the only platform people are sick of using.

headline.main: Readers Debate the Merits of Social Media Before and After the Election

docs.snippet: A live stream on Facebook takes us into a car where a fatal police shooting occurred, emphasizing the gulf between virtual and physical presence.

headline.print_headline: In 10 Terrible Minutes, a Tale of Race, the Police and Death
headline.main: A Killing. A Pointed Gun. And Two Black Lives, Witnessing.

docs.abstract: Diamond Reynolds streams video on Facebook Live, which allows users worldwide to share moment immediately after police fatally shoot her boyfriend Philando Castile during traffic stop in Minnesota; video has propelled case to national attention and sparked Justice Dept to open investigation into fatal shooting.

docs.snippet: On paper, the world is freer than ever. Yet minds feel more crimped, fear more pervasive, escape more elusive.
Underneath the braggadocio and evisceration of professional nemeses in Antonio García Martinez’s book lies the beating heart of a formidable teacher.

headline.main: Review: ‘Chaos Monkeys’ Is a Guide to the Spirit of Silicon Valley

docs.snippet: Netanyahu and Rubio are wrong. Toughness is no more than empty aggression when it will not admit to misjudgment.
The benefits of immigration outweigh the costs. But American openness is shrinking.
